assets.name: Braking System

threats.name: Tampering via V2X Communication
objectives: Cause accidents through unauthorized braking system control

scenarios.scenario_description: Attacker intercepts V2X communication between vehicles and sends false braking commands to the target vehicle, resulting in unauthorized braking system control.
Attacker floods the V2X communication channel with numerous fake messages, overwhelming the system and causing the braking system to be disabled.

threats.name: Unauthorized Access via Mobile App Integration
objectives: Gain control over the braking system remotely

vectors.vector_name: Exploiting Vulnerabilities in Mobile App Security

scenarios.scenario_description: Attacker identifies a vulnerability in the mobile app used for integration with the braking system and exploits it to gain unauthorized access and control over the system.

vectors.vector_name: Phishing Attack Targeting Mobile App Users

scenarios.scenario_description: Attacker sends phishing emails or messages to mobile app users tricking them into revealing their credentials, which are then used to gain access to the braking system.

threats.name: Unauthorized Access via Mobile App Integration
objectives: Gain control of the infotainment system

scenarios.scenario_description: Attacker intercepts the communication between the mobile app and the infotainment system to eavesdrop on sensitive data or inject malicious commands.
Attacker positions themselves between the mobile app and the infotainment system, allowing them to manipulate data or commands exchanged between the two entities.

threats.name: Malware Injection via USB Ports
objectives: Gain unauthorized access to the braking system
Disrupt the functionality of the braking system

scenarios.scenario_description: Attacker inserts a USB device with malware into a USB port of the vehicle's system, allowing the malware to execute and gain access to the braking system

consequences: Physical harm to driver and passengers

scenarios.scenario_description: Attacker uses a Bluetooth sniffer device to intercept data transmitted between the infotainment system and paired devices.
Attacker exploits Bluetooth vulnerabilities in the infotainment system to establish unauthorized connections and access sensitive data.
